image_base_path.title: Trap images
image_base_path.description: The root folder containing images from all nights that will be processed. It is recommended to start with a small sample.

database_url.title: Database connection string
database_url.description: Defaults to a local SQLite database that will automatically be created. Supports PostgreSQL.

user_data_path.title: Local directory for models, thumbnails & reports
user_data_path.description: Model weights are between 100-200Mb and will be downloaded the first time a model is used.

localization_model.title: Localization model
localization_model.description: Model & settings to use for object detection in original images from camera trap.

binary_classification_model.title: Binary classification model
binary_classification_model.description: Model & settings to use for moth / non-moth classification of cropped images after object detection.

taxon_classification_model.title: Species classification model
taxon_classification_model.description: Model & settings to use for fine-grained species or taxon-level classification of cropped images after moth/non-moth detection.

tracking_algorithm.title: Occurrence tracking algorithm (de-duplication)
tracking_algorithm.description: Method of identifying and tracking the same individual moth across multiple images.

classification_threshold.title: Classification threshold
classification_threshold.description: Only show results with a confidence score greater or equal to this value.

localization_batch_size.title: Localization batch size
localization_batch_size.description: Number of images to process per-batch during localization. These are large images (e.g. 4096x2160px), smaller batch sizes are appropriate (1-10). Reduce this if you run out of memory.

classification_batch_size.title: Classification batch size
classification_batch_size.description: Number of images to process per-batch during classification. These are small images (e.g. 50x100px), larger batch sizes are appropriate (10-200). Reduce this if you run out of memory.

num_workers.title: Number of workers
num_workers.description: Number of parallel workers for the PyTorch dataloader. See https://pytorch.org/docs/stable/data.html
